content: the CPFMTXA command. If only a few volumes are involved, that is fine, but when you must format many volumes, the process of running CPFMTXA can be time-consuming and tedious, which can lead to errors. Therefore, a REXX EXEC that is named CPFORMAT is provided in the tar file that is associated with this book. With it, you can format many volumes with a single command. This EXEC is shown in Appendix B, “Reference, cheat sheets, blank worksheets, and education” on page 475. It is a wrapper around CPFMTXA. To use this EXEC, each DASD to be formatted must first be attached with the virtual device address and the same real device address (by using ATTACH realDev *). This EXEC will label the volumes according to the convention that is described in 2.11.1, “DASD volume labeling convention” on page 58.
